repo.description: Powerful Tox chat client that follows the Tox design guidelines.
repo.name: qTox

body: I couldn't build the project without a couple of edits to the cmake file, everything was working before. - `${TOXCORE_VERSION}` is only available if pkg_check_modules was successful. - The project should be also linked against `toxav` and `toxencryptsave` which are installed by toxcore's cmake file. Signed-off-by: Nikolay Borodin - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/qTox/206)

comment_regular_data.body:
Which version of toxcore are you using? We haven't been installing toxav/toxencryptsave as separate modules for a long time.

I'm not against this change though, it seems to be happy with all the current CI builds regardless.

@iphydf

> Which version of toxcore are you using? 

I've upgraded from 0.2.18 to 0.2.20, but it turns out CMake can't even find these libraries.

> We haven't been installing toxav/toxencryptsave as separate modules for a long time.

But CMake does.

I did a `git checkout` to `v0.2.20` and after that did a `make install` and this is what I ended up with:

`ls /usr/local/lib/libtox*`

```
/usr/local/lib/libtoxav.a
/usr/local/lib/libtoxav.la
/usr/local/lib/libtoxav.so
/usr/local/lib/libtoxav.so.2
/usr/local/lib/libtoxav.so.2.20.0
/usr/local/lib/libtoxcore.a
/usr/local/lib/libtoxcore.la
/usr/local/lib/libtoxcore.so
/usr/local/lib/libtoxcore.so.2
/usr/local/lib/libtoxcore.so.2.20.0
/usr/local/lib/libtoxencryptsave.a
/usr/local/lib/libtoxencryptsave.la
/usr/local/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so
/usr/local/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so.2
/usr/local/lib/libtoxencryptsave.so.2.20.0
/usr/local/lib/libtoxext.a
/usr/local/lib/libtox_extension_messages.a
```
Are you using `./configure` or cmake? I don't see how cmake can do this, especially given you have libtool files in that directory, which are an autotools thing.

> Are you using `./configure` or cmake? I don't see how cmake can do this, especially given you have libtool files in that directory, which are an autotools thing.

Yes, I may have made a mistake and used autotools. But still, if someone uses autotools and the project doesn't build (and it did before), there will be issues.
Yup, definitely. Does this PR make it work for you?
Also, can you sign your commit? I can't do it for you because you're forked from qTox/qTox. I can only sign commits in forks of TokTok/qTox.

> Also, can you sign your commit? I can't do it for you because you're forked from qTox/qTox. I can only sign commits in forks of TokTok/qTox.

@iphydf I think it's done. It might be worth redoing the fork later.

It's not signed yet:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5937bd8f-5d4d-418c-b94d-f812b5f204e7)

should look like this:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7de050cb-302e-4ea4-a552-1f45385caa0d)

See the "verified" bit.

> It's not signed yet:
> 
> ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/10647936/393232299-5937bd8f-5d4d-418c-b94d-f812b5f204e7.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..fvaCdz_ky0wq6Jh94PF15zbEiU7GLdxXgb_EWlmo150)
> 
> should look like this:
> 
> ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/10647936/393232382-7de050cb-302e-4ea4-a552-1f45385caa0d.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..jLMAiz74u5-nZrjXq4eo7384oWj8HIOes9EK3VaY2II)
> 
> See the "verified" bit.

@iphydf  As always, it worked on the third try.

Signed-off-by: Nikolay Borodin <monsterovich@gmail.com>
